events.name: ArtScience on Screen: Anime Season – My Neighbour Totoro
events.description:
ArtScience on Screen: Anime Season – My Neighbour Totoro

My Neighbour Totoro is a classic Japanese animated fantasy film about two young girls, Satsuki and her younger sister Mei, and their adventure when they discover that the nearby forest is inhabited by magical playful creatures called Totoros.

As part of Anime Season, ArtScience on Screen presents this extraordinary, award-winning animated classic from iconic animation company, Studio Ghibli. Enjoy this masterpiece of astounding visual beauty and imagination from the unrivalled dream factory running this July.

Dates and Screening Times: 
17 - 18 July, 21 - 23 July, 28 - 31 July 
11AM, 12.30PM, 2PM, 3.30PM, 5PM
Rating: G
Running time:1 hour 30 mins
Screening in English with no subtitles

Venue: Expression Gallery, Level 4
Free Admission

#ArtScienceonScreen

events.name: Automating Interaction with Chatbots
events.description:
Chatbots are computer programs that can interact with humans through a simple conversational interface. They are designed to simulate an interaction with another human. Couple this with the fact that more than 90% of smartphone users spend most of their time in messaging apps such as Facebook Messenger and you have an excellent opportunity to build highly interactive chatbot based services that can empower business and enterprise like never before. 

AGENDA

Introduction to ChatBot & WebHooks
Showcase what are the chatbot out there in the market
AI & NLP engine behind chatbot (API.ai & Motion.ai)
Store and retrieve record from database via Chatbot
Conversation keyword detection and chat stories


MEET THE PEOPLE



Kenneth Phang
Lecturer & Consultant, Startups & SMEs practice – Institute of Systems Science,NUS
Previously held the position of Assistant VP at SGX.



REQUIREMENTS


Participants to bring own laptop

RESERVING A SEAT

Enter the promotional code that accompanies the invitation email sent to you to reserve a seat. Limited seats available. Hurry!
events.location: StackUp Studio, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-09, Singapore 139955

events.name: Social Coding
events.description: A space for women coders to learn from each other, to practice and discuss learnings with fellow peers. This would be a weekly event of informal space to do coding. So bring your pet projects along or join one of our existing teams/ projects to work on. Featured Projects:https://trello.com/b/kl2BTwil/wwc-sg-social-coding-projects First timers, please read:Newbies Step-by-step Guide Please bring your own laptop. Agenda:6:30p - Registration and Introduce projects7:00p - Break out into groups and Start coding! ^_^8:30p - End session There is no food provided, so please make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, we recommend to bring your own water bottle along. Psst, this event is intended for ladies only. Host:
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre
